- 2790 hours (8 September 2020):
I believe I can recommend the game again. Some of the reasons I recommended against purchasing Dead by Daylight have been resolved or are in the middle of being resolved. Again, I still play the game, my concern was for newcomers joining at an unfortunate time half a year ago.

- 2529 hours (26 February 2020): Currently not recommending to buy the game due to severe issues with match-making, ranking issues, and balancing.

Do not get me wrong, I obviously still play the game, since as a Veteran DbD player, I can deal with these issues, but they are unacceptable for a new player coming to the game. I currently would not tell any of my friends to get the game, even on sale, as I believe they would get frustrated with the issues quite quickly and quit it.

I'd rather have them step into The Fog during a time when these issues are resolved and they can enjoy the game. Once the issues are addressed, my review is likely to change back to recommended.

- 1908 hours in (25 July 2018): The best sign of the game FINALLY starting to go back towards a balanced state is the Survivor mains review-bombing Patch 2.1.0 (even though, they only got minor nerfs, I don't want to imagine how petty they'll be once their beloved crutch Perk Decisive Strike is nerfed). Killer mains and Players who play both sides could finally rechoice with 2.1.0. The devs seem to have gotten the message and I'm thankful for that. As an impartial player of both sides from day one, I'm so happy to be able to recommend the game again.

- 1727 hours in (15 April 2018): The game seems to be taking the first few cautious steps in the direction of some balance again, but it's still way too soon to really tell what the devs will break next (yes, a running gag that's all too true). The new Emblem System took some pressure off of Killers and punishes Survivors playing the game for shits and giggles, trying to bully the Killer. However, none of that addresses the broken core mechanics of the game, that hugely favour Survivor if they simply focus on doing their objective instead of clowning about, so I'm still not going to recommend it until further changes take place.

- 1430 hours in (7 November 2017): It's been a long time since my last update to this review. Sadly, once again I cannot recommend to buy Dead by Daylight and thus support the Developers anymore. The game is riddled with problems the devs ignore or are blatantly not willing to address and fix. The game becomes a clown fiesta for the Killer from mid-ranks upwards. Survivors disconnect to save their crutch items and generally, the game is more toxic than ever. People have lost all sense of manners and sportsmanlike conduct. IF there's anything to be abused, it will be.

Also, the developers have just recently acknowledged that they will from now on balance the game for the lowest ranks, meaning newcomer and low-skilled casual players :steamfacepalm:

None, literally no competitive game, even if it still tries to be that, balances around the end of spectrum, especially not the low-end. Small changes there have immense balance impacts on high ranks with experienced players.

They should fire their statistics guy in all honesty as I have rarily seen such incompetence in creating and interpreting statistics. Most high schoolers would do a better job at that.

- 906 hours in: I think I can finally recommend it again and I'm happy to do so. Patch 1.5. has brought some much needed changes and after adapting a bit to the new mechanics, the game finally again feels like it has originally been envisioned by the developers. Killer feels like a powerful killing machine again and playing Survivor is now challenging again across the board, something I missed. Unlike many crybabies on the forums (people who exploited and didn't learn how to properly play the game) I know that the game is going in the right direction now and I couldn't be happier. I would have felt really sad to give up a game I've now played for so, so long because it was no longer the game I fell in love with almost a year ago. I'm so glad that things changed.

- Now 757 hours in. Haven't played nearly as much as I used to, because the game is going in the wrong direction, I can't recommend it anymore and I'm so sad about that. At least not in the current state it is in. Killers get treated as the personal fuck toy of mid to higher ranked Survivors, the game is heavily unbalanced and the devs seem to do everything in their might to make it even more so. With the newest update, they added 2 perks that once they become the new meta, they will make Survivors more or less invincible. Killer mains are leaving the game in heaps now. I don't want to see this game die, but the developers are completely clueless about the problems they have and have no idea of their own game in mid/high ranks as they are all low ranked players, catering to the need of low ranked Survivors, not realising that they give experienced players more and more tools to fuck with Killers.

- 735 hours by now, can't believe that I haven't gotten tired of the game yet, although I'm feeling a bit burnt-out as Killer, you need to be a masochist to play the high ranked games as one, but thankfully, that is about to change.

- Still going strong after 566 hours. I can't get enough of this game, it's almost like a drug. Absolutely love it. Sure there are bugs and annoying things, but most of the time, they are minor and the devs are (contrary to popular belief) constantly working on fixing them and keeping the game alive.

- Alright, 373 hours in, I'm going to back up my own review. Still love this game ^^

"ORIGINAL REVIEW from 19 August 2016: [i]Absolutely love this game, I'm now over 200 hours in and it still doesn't get boring as no two games are the same, also there is a big diversity of areas and maps and there will be even more in the future. I recommend it to anyone that likes the horror genre and the Survivors-get-chased-by-a-Killer theme.

P.S. Don't get discouraged by all the negative reviews. 85% of them are by people with very low gameplay time. This game takes several hours to "git gud" as you need to learn how to play against each of the four Killers and counter each of their specific abilities and unique play styles. Practice really makes perfect in this game. Same thing applies when you play as Killer, you need to learn how all the game mechanics work.[/i]"

This game started out with a ton of potential, but two months later the basic issues are still there.  Lobby queues take longer than ever, killers can still dodge survivors to find a favorable matchup, there are still many bugs and glitches that have been in the game since launch.  This game may turn out to be great in the future, but right now it seems to be regressing.

dead by daylight это та игра которая застовляет сердце биться быстрее!Не от радости а от страха когда за твоей спиной стоит моньячина.В игре очень интересный гемплей как за моньяка так и за выжившего.
Те кто жалуються на дизболанс в игре сильно ошибаються так как весомое превосходство моньяка над студентами добовляет хардкорность игре,так же сложность добовляет то что выжившие не могут драться только фонариком посветить и то это глушит моньяка на 2-3 секунды.Кстате выжившие куда проворнее моньяка так что если руки не кривые то вполне можно оторваться от моньяка и затащить раунд!

I really love the concept of this game. Although there are certain bugs I would like fixed and some of the perks worked differently, the game is still overall great.

I bought this game during pre-order because I wanted to play the beta. It was amazing, with a ton of glitches and fucked up shit happening. When the game was released, most of these went unfixed and was effectively still released in a beta state. I still played the game becasue I thought it would be awesome. And it was, untill about two weeks ago when a game breaking glitch that causes your game to reset as if you never played the game. Most people lose achievments when this happens. I didn't. Instead, I lost everything else. So I stopped playing untill they fixed this. I then started playing again today and was getting up in rank when the game crashed because I was healing another survivor. This cause me to reset my survivor rank to 20 and lose jall pips in the game. I then go and look at the forums to find out that the first glitch is still happening to people and this glitch has been known about for some time. I now know that this game will end up as a dead game because the devs don't actually care about fixing their game. They say the fix the problems but aren't fixing anything. 

Don't buy this game. You will waste your time and your money. Its not worth even $5.00 untill all of these problems are actually fixed.

DEAD BY DAYLIGHT IN A NUTSHELL
"Dead By Daylight" is a very nerve racking game. You can either play as a survivor, or a killer. There are multiple killers and each have their own rait, the Trapper, the Hillbilly, the Wraith and in the new update:The Nurse! For each killer there is a map, the Nurse is set in an asylum, the Hillbilly, Wraith and Trapper meanwhilst have all their own outside worlds. The aim of the game is to simply activate all the generators around the map if you are a survivor, you can play as four survivors, Claudette, Dwight, Med and Jake. And in the new update: Nea. If all generators are reactivated the survivors must open the exit, at the same time however the killer has to sabotage you, if you hear a racing heart beat or bells he is close to you and you must hide. If you panic then it makes it easier for the killer to find you. However you can hide yourself in Lockers. If found the killer will put you on a hook which counts down to your death, your team mates however can help you by unhooking you. If your are left on a hook too long you die and you are out. If you are injured you can heal one another. 

MY OPINION
Although it is a new game, me and my friends couldn't find a way as to how to play with another without the full party total of five, and we thought that we had to get our other friends to buy the game so we can all play as one. When doing research i realised that alot of other people had the same problem. We fixed this when one of us is a killer, they select "Kill Your Friends" and then invite others. The game is very fast paced and frightnening. Even the sound of the killers heartbeat makes you feel chilly. Me and my friends personally love this game and play it together when we can. It is a good multiplayer horror game :)  If i had to say anything negative is that it is annoying trying to join a lobby, it doesn't join yu straight away. I've seen people write about how they have had to wait like 30 minutes to join one. I didn't have this problem, if you don't get into a lobby just try again, it may take a while but barely even 2 minutes. Overall this is my favourite multiplayer horror game. If i had to rate it i would give it 10 out of 10 and 5 stars. It is BRILLIANT and worth the money. Hope this helped :)

This isn't a complete review but I'd just like to say a few things:

I really enjoy the concept/gameplay on the whole, with a couple of caveats

The 'partial' controller support refers to bad support for menu navigation, which is annoying but not prohibitive, the actual gameplay works great.

The main thing that I think this game could benifit from is skill/rank-based matchmaking.
For all I know this already exists and my local community is just to small but I feel that the learning curve is vastly steepened when half your opponents are very high-ranking and 'exploit' limitations in the game/physics.
It's not an illegitimate tactic, it's not even metagaming but it does make it difficult to learn when you're up against rank 10 or better every other game and therefore get to observe less mistakes.

None the less I would recommend the game, and say that it's best played and started together with friends.

Seit dem Update 1.1.0 ist das Spiel unspielbar... Versucht man einer Lobby beizutreten: Geht es... NICHT!

Versucht man eine Lobby als Killer ( und vor allem als Krankenschwester ) zu eröffnen schmiert das Spiel ständig ab.

Die Krankenschwester ist meiner und auch vielen anderer Meinung nach viel zu OP! Da jetzt auch noch manche Maps wie die Coldwindfarm geändert wurden, hat man es den Killern viel zu leicht gemacht.

Ich hoffe dass das alles bald gefixt wird. Bis dahin kann ich das Spiel keinem empfehlen.

Update: Seit dem Halloweenupdate mit Michael Myers ist das Spiel unspielbar geworden... Andauernd schleicht er sich von irgendwo an oder "stalkt" dich und macht in damit zum ultimativen Killer. Als Überlebender hat man kaum noch Chance zu überleben, da über 90% Camperkiller sind und dir sonst auch kaum jemand hilft.

ХУЙНЯ ПОЛНАЯ, ДИЗБАЛАНС!!!

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

At release the game was fun, very buggy but fun. Game seemed balanced (not perfect) from both sides Survivor/Killer. You could easily score enough points on both sides. Updates come and the game slowly got worse. They're "balancing" is purely in favor for the Killer, and it's getting worse.  It's like the Devs want people who play Killer to have fun and win, while survivors struggle and get the worst end of the game. The attempt to "balance" Killer and Survivors is a joke. As if the Devs favor playing the Killers. Trying to find a match went from bad to incredibly terrible, to the point you have to trick the system to get in a game. Also, keep in mind almost ALL the bugs from launch still exist. It's evident the Devs do not listen to the community, and have their heads stuck up their rears. I ultimately see this game loosing in the long run, from crappy bugs that go unattended and poor balancing.

Die Idee hinter diesem Spiel ist super, man verbindet Horror mit Multiplayer.
ABER leider hakt es bei DbD an allen Ecken und Kanten.

1. Es gibt/gab keine Möglichkeit mit Freunden gemeinsam einer MP-Lobby beizutreten, 
man muss solange Lobbyhopping betreiben bis man sich findet.

2. Das Spiel hat keinerlei Langzeitmotivation, das Skillsystem ist nach einigen Runden komplett
freigespielt und die 2-3 Klamotten sind nicht wirklich besonders.

3. Die geringe Anzahl an auswählbaren Charakteren/Monstern ist auch eher ein Witz

Fazit: Es hat wirklich die ersten 2h Spaß gemacht, falls man sich in einer Lobby fand, danach wurde es aber sehr stumpf und fade. Deshalb habe ich es direkt wieder Zurückgegeben.

Persönlich rate ich jedem Spieler dieses Spiel "noch" nicht zu kaufen bis sie irgendwann einmal genug Kontent ins Spiel gebracht haben.

Played this game since it first came out. Liked the game more when it first came out as it was mainly hide and seek with a killer. Now it's more like an objective rushing game.

It's great fun for groups of friends playing together however playing with friends disadvantages the killer. If you play killer with a controller you will also be at a disadvantage because the mouse people can turn on a dime.

The gameplay feels the same everygame. One of the best strats while playing survivor is to loop around pallets until you need them. The gameplay at that point for the killer and survivor is nothing more than looping. It should be called a circle running simulator and is as tiring as running circles in real life. 

The toxic people have lessened quite a bit but I wouldn't recommend this to children or sensitive people. 

It's worth buying on sale.

My favorite part of this game is definitely the waiting. It's always riveting to see my screen fade to black only to be told I failed to connect to the lobby! What was that? You actually want to play the game? No, Fuck you. You get to wait while killers dodge you and you fail at connecting or playing the game you purchased. 
In all honesty, it is an extremely addicting and fun game that can be played again and again without really feeling repetitive or tiresome. It has so much potential. The only issue seems to be all these annoying, and I mean ANNOYING, bugs that pop up that make it so incredibly frustrating.
If you can get past the rage, bugs, lobbies, and campers, I would definitely recommend this game.
отличная

Dead by Daylight is a lot of fun to the average game player. The game has only been out for a short amount of time though, so only expect it to constantly update and get better.

that being said:
pros
[list]
[*]A ton of progression, you'll likely spend a significant amount of time unlocking perks
[*]Stressful and a high chance of panic. At first it's very scary and tense, and now after 70 hours. it's less scary but still tense.
[*]I've enjoyed all 70 hours.
[*]that feeling of friendship when an ally saves you from a killers grasp.
[*]that feeling of heroism upon saving an ally.
[*]An great sense of pride if you play well. I once completely hid right under a killers nose. Then got away afterwards.
[*]cosmetics, to look spunky.
[*]great time with friends.
[/list]

it's not without it's faults though.

cons:

[list]
[*]the queue times can be a mess, but they've stated that they're looking into them.
[*]I've been matched with an amazing killer, and terrible teammates. Making the chances of winning very small.
[*]Vice versa, terrible killer, amazing teammates. takes away the tense feeling of avoiding the killer.
[*]the progression system can take a LONG time. You'll get a bunch of worthless perks, then get good ones.
[*]The Nurse. When you first fight one she's op. Then you learn to juke.
[*]no mouth animations. Really just a lack of polished animations. Imagine screaming into the night with your mouth closed.
[*]After a long time. The game becomes less scary. Almost no scare factor period.
[*]Made by the people of PAYDAY 2. So there's going to be a crap load of paid DLC.
[/list]

I rate a solid 7/10. I'm going to keep playing. I'll buy the DLC if I have to. I enjoy it alot and it's good to see Developers work so hard and have such a nice outcome.
Good Game
running in circles has never felt so invigorating

Really enjoyable game. I used to play it loads with my friends, still play it time to time. The only thing I would say is, if you don't play consistently then you lack in bloodpoints for perks, and can't play efficiently. The community can also be very toxic at times, but if you can get past all of that, its quite enjoyable, and definitely would recommend getting, with a few DLCS during a sale ( which happen quite frequently). The diverseness of original killers, and survivors mixed in with classic and well known killers, and characters is really amazing too!

我再次修改一下，说真的，人皇会遛还是遛的屠夫团团转，而且加上现在低于15端的我们也碰不到，改不改档无所谓，，而且本来就是恐怖游戏，修机靠的是技巧而不是死修，你们去看，一个屠夫如果没作为，人类修机飞起来，就是预判屠夫大概多久来电机提前躲好，带个心灵感应，还怕啥，就怕sb队友开局我还没摸电机呢就被抓，然后三挣扎一放手。搞毛，[spoiler]，初始化游戏通过改下载地区，卸载wegame这两个方法，如果有挂逼，请用win10的NVIDIA的录屏录下来，发给官方邮件，

[i]The reason ...and my official review of [b]EAC[/b]:[/i] http://steamcommunity.com/id/EviLFazZ/recommended/282660

[table]
If you are looking for a free and effective method to inject [i]Ebola[/i] into your online games, then look no further than any installation of [b]EasyAntiCheat[/b] aka [b]EAC[/b] (it's also now part of Rust and Dead by Daylight) 🙁

It is so effective that it will also 'completely' disable our beloved [b]Steam Controllers[/b], as well as all other Xinput devices, such as; Logitech's G13, HTC/Steam's VR Controllers, gaming keyboards with Xinput compatibility (such as my Corsair K95 RGB) and MicroSoft's Xbox 360 and One controllers 😬

Well done [b]EasyAntiCheat Ltd[/b] on disabling hardware I have purchased (in multiples) to play games how we choose to in our cave. You have completely ruined two outstanding games that we used to play regularly (especially Dead by Daylight) until you showed up within them and are truly shocked that [b]Valve[/b] has even let you near [b]Steam[/b] for so long 😠
[/table]

[b]Get off our beautiful planet [i]...you disgusting putrid disease[/i][/b] 😡

Despite it's [b]many[/b] graphical bugs, low connection ratio and my short playtime (in the final release)... [b]I'm loving it already[/b] 😻

[i]It's already a fun game, but sadly feels a lot like a typical unfinished beta... BUT with some 'major' graphical updates, more options (audio, visual and [strike]keymap[/strike] ...available now), Ui mapping (not just based on pointer clicks), server improvements and annoying bug fixes, this 'could be' an outstanding multiplayer (1 vs. 5) game[/i] 😉

Dont waste your time or money. Broken game where skill is punished by Devs and abuse of mechanics/exploits are part of the game which will never be fixed. Most pallets on map have been removed, stupid two different kinds of running vaults through window (slow jump 2.1 meters before the window and fucking slow ass crawl through window run vault), window vault in general has been slowed because Devs have to give unskilled killers a handicap and now the doctors map is utterly pointless because you cant hide from the doctor but can only evade him, well not anymore, and I could go on but short answer is its broken. Not even worth discount cause thats how the Devs get you for more money and refill the player base to get positive reviews then shafts you in the ass later with another update. Rinse and repeat.

Edit: After all these years they finally give the game a graphic update and cosmetic improvement with actions and maps. Same old shit, make the game look as good as possible but dont fix your broken game. Devs do everything they can to bring players back but do not fix their game breaking mechanics and exploits.
